title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
summary: A science fiction epic about politics, religion, and ecology on the desert planet Arrakis.

author: George Orwell
summary: A dystopian novel about totalitarianism and surveillance.

title: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: The first volume of The Lord of the Rings, following Frodo's journey to destroy the One Ring.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: A romantic novel of manners about Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: A portrait of the Jazz Age in all of its decadence and excess.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
summary: A gripping tale of racial injustice and childhood innocence in Depression-era Alabama.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: Bilbo Baggins's unexpected journey with dwarves to reclaim their mountain home.

title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
summary: A collection of twelve detective stories featuring the iconic Sherlock Holmes.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
summary: A dystopian vision of a technologically advanced future where humans are genetically bred.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
summary: Holden Caulfield's journey through New York City after being expelled from prep school.
